metadata.title: CVE-2017-14489 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The iscsi_if_rx function in drivers/scsi/scsi_transport_iscsi.c in theLinux kernel through 4.13.2 allows local users to cause a denial of service(panic) by leveraging incorrect length validation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14489` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-17-generic - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-4.13.0-17-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-4.13.0-17-lowlatency - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-17-generic - 4.13.0-17.20
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-17.20').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1006.6').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
